meanings.definition: To arm or equip with weapons.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers will enarm themselves before heading into battle.
meanings.sent2: The knight will enarm himself with a sword and shield.
meanings.sent3: The pirates decided to enarm themselves with water guns for a playful water fight.
meanings.sent4: She enarmed herself with knowledge to face the challenges ahead.
meanings.sent5: The superhero enarmed himself with courage to fight against evil forces.

meanings.sent1: The blacksmith will enarm the knight with a shiny new armor.
meanings.sent2: The ancient warriors used to enarm themselves with metal plates for protection.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy knight accidentally enarmed his horse with a tiny helmet.
meanings.sent4: The castle walls enarm the kingdom against enemy attacks.
meanings.sent5: The armorer enarms the soldiers with strong shields and helmets.

meanings.sent1: Eating healthy food can enarm your body against illnesses.
meanings.sent2: The reinforcements will enarm the city's defenses during the siege.
meanings.sent3: The magical potion enarmed the hero with incredible strength.
meanings.sent4: Positive thoughts can enarm your mind against negativity.
meanings.sent5: The team spirit enarms the players with determination to win the game.
